RACE.RACE_TEXT: LOUISIANA DOWNS RACE 1 5F Turf CR: 57. Maiden Claiming Purse 16000. FOR ACCREDITED LA BRED MAIDENS, THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $17,500. (If deemed inadvisable by management to run this race over the turf course, it will be run on the main track at Five Furlongs).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: THE BOYZ PRIORITY vied for the lead, settled at the front of the pack in the three path, was inside of another rival and set the pace in a set, bid at the three eighths pole along the inside, took command at the five sixteenth pole, led at the quarter pole and through the stretch, held sway. MYGLORYBEE raced on the rail, settled mid pack, advanced into a stalking position down the back side, stayed patient of the fence through the turn, saved ground and closed up the rail nicely getting up for the place position. STRUTTIN APRIORITY raced off of the pace, settled in hands, raced in the five path and on the outside, edged out into the six path in the turn and into the stretch, ran a b it green in the stretch but still closed well and was able to get third. SPARKIN raced in the middle of the pack in the three path, outside of another horse, edged out in the turn and improved position, was six wide in the stretch, finished even. TONTERIA was racing five wide and on the outside in the second tier, shifted into the three path leaving the turn, was a bit green in the stretch as he passed other rivals, found room on the rail mid stretch and closed well while improving position late. SERRANO'S WARRIOR vied for the lead from the three path, settled next to another front runner and set the pace in a set, lost ground in thee turn and flattened out. SAINT DADDY missed break, settled off of the pace, passed tired rivals. ADIAMONDINTHESTORM was off of the pace in the four path, raced outside of another foe and was no factor. PUNCHIE was in the second tier of horses in between foes, shuffled back, saved ground, but showed little.

ENTRY.NAME: Myglorybee
ENTRY.COMMENT: rail, mid pack, clean trip, saved ground, closed, up for 2nd

ENTRY.NAME: Punchie
ENTRY.COMMENT: 2nd tier, btwn foes, shuffled back, 3w, rail, stretch, shwd litte

ENTRY.NAME: The Boyz Priority
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied, 3w, led in a set, bid 3/8, took control, held sway

ENTRY.NAME: Sparkin
ENTRY.COMMENT: mid pack, 3w, outside, shifted out stretch, finished even

ENTRY.NAME: Serrano's Warrior
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied, led, 3w, lost ground turn, flattened out

ENTRY.NAME: Tonteria
ENTRY.COMMENT: 5w, 2nd tier, outside, 3w, green, rail, closed, improved late

ENTRY.NAME: Struttin Apriority
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace, settled in hands, 5w, 6w, upper, green stretch, closed

RACE.RACE_TEXT: LOUISIANA DOWNS RACE 2 1M 70Y Dirt CR: 72. Claiming Purse 14500. FOR ACCREDITED LA BRED THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since June 1, 2023 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: MY HEAVY SON settled off of the pace and on the rail, launched a bid at the three eighths pole, saved ground, got a clean trip, battled with another closing rival to the outside, out finished that rival and got up for the win. SHADY GRADY vied for the lead, had company on the lead the whole trip, set the fractions as a set, took the lead after the half mile pole, showed the way through the turn in the two path, was challenged by the five sixteenth pole, battled through the stretch and faltered. THE THIMBLE was off a bit slow, raced four wide, settled into last, bid 3/8, shifted five wide down the stretch, and closed. PAYNTED LOVER vied for the lead, matched strides and traded for the lead down the back side with another front runner, was on the outside in the two and three path, then flattened out in the stretch. DOUBLE PRIORITY raced in the middle of the field and tired late.

ENTRY.NAME: My Heavy Son
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace, rail, bid 3/8, saved ground, clean trip, battled, outfi

ENTRY.NAME: Shady Grady
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied, matched with foe while pace setting, led after 1/2, battled

ENTRY.NAME: The Thimble
ENTRY.COMMENT: 4w, settled at the back of the field, bid 3/8, 5w, stretch

RACE.RACE_TEXT: LOUISIANA DOWNS RACE 3 5F Turf CR: 81. Claiming Purse 15500. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since June 1 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $12,500. (If deemed inadvisable by management to run this race over the turf course, it will be run on the main track at Five Furlongs).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: THINKITASADONATION raced mid pack in the four path, launched a bid at the three eighths pole, circled the field through the turn, challenged for the lead at the quarter pole, battled under urging and encouragement, responded well and drew off after the last sixteenth marker and won with a game effort. MISS JAMIE was in the two path as she vied for t he lead, established herself as the pace setter and led through the turn, was challenged by another rival at the quarter pole, hooked and battled down the lane, ws urged and encouraged, but could not sustain the bid and came up short finishing second. TWN MS MIDSHIP raced in the three path, stalked just of the leaders side on the outside, raced in between foes as the eventual winner matched strides with the front runners, tried to go with the eventual winner but could not, and chased the top two dow the lane finishing third. VALLEJO was three wide while racing off of the pace, maintained position down the nack side, launched a bid at the three eighths pole, circled the filed through the turn on the outside, shifted into the seven path in the u peer stretch, taking the widest trip, responded well to encouragement and closed well. ALYS EPISODE was racing two wide and stalked the front runners in the packet, had other competitors on the out side, tried briefly st find a way to shift out but had to sit chilly and wait for racing room on the inside, lost momentum leaving the turn and never got back in the race. PREACH IT GIRL was off a bit slow early on, settled in hand and followed the rest of the field, shifted into the six path at the upper stretch, was encouraged and urged, hung. CRYSTAL CRESCENT showed little. BLUEBIRD SING trailed through out.

ENTRY.NAME: Preach It Girl
ENTRY.COMMENT: off slw, last, rail, gained ground, shifted 6 wide, upper, hung

ENTRY.NAME: Vallejo
ENTRY.COMMENT: 3w, off pce, circled turn, 7 wide, upper, closed well

ENTRY.NAME: Alys Episode
ENTRY.COMMENT: 2w, stalked, waited for room leaving turn, lacked late bid

ENTRY.NAME: Miss Jamie
ENTRY.COMMENT: 2w, vied, led, battled down the stretch, came up short,

ENTRY.NAME: Thinkitasadonation
ENTRY.COMMENT: midpck, 4w, bid 3/8, circled turn, chllngd 1/4, battled, drewoff

ENTRY.NAME: Twn Ms Midship
ENTRY.COMMENT: 3w, staked, btwn, passed5-16th, not enough today

RACE.RACE_TEXT: LOUISIANA DOWNS RACE 4 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 74. Claiming Purse 19000. FOR ACCREDITED LA BRED FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES OR WHICH HAVE NOT WON TWO RACES IN 2023. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since June 1, 2023 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $12,500.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: COMMERCIAL FLASH vied for the lead, raced on the outside of two other foes in the four path, shook off on of the early front runners at the five sixteenth pole, challenged the other front runner head to head at the quarter pole, shifted out a bit in the upper stretch, was asked to shift in closed to battle for the lead with his rival at the eighth pole, raced and battled hard down the last eighth of a mile and COMMERCIAL FLASH was able to get his nose in front and pull off the win. OURPERFECTPRINCESS vied for the lead on the rail, had three other competitors on the out side also trying to set the pace, had pressure the whole race, briefly led in the upper stretch, was hooked by a hard charging outside contender, battled the rest of the race in a hard fought battle, came up short by a nose and took second place today. NEW YEAR'S PARTY raced in the five path on the outside of other rivals, was in the second tier of racers, launched a bid at t he half mile marker, shifted out in the turn and went the widest of all, closed well improving positions late, up for third. INAWIC raced on the rail while being clear off of the pace, shifted out six wide in the upper stretch but to no avail. GIRL THIRSTY was off of the pace and racing on the rail, saved grpund, improved position late. AVERI EVER AFTER trailed, passed tired rivals. SEE SASSY RUN vied for the lead, raced in between while on the front end, gave way. A. K. A. GRAMS 4w, raced near the back of the field, and showed little.

ENTRY.NAME: Girl Thirsty
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace, rail, improved position late

ENTRY.NAME: Ourperfectprincess
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied, rail, set the pace, pressured through out, led 1/4f, bttld

ENTRY.NAME: New Year's Party
ENTRY.COMMENT: 5w, 2nd tier, bid 1/2, widest through the turn, closed well

ENTRY.NAME: Commercial Flash
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied, 4w, outside, challenged 1/4, battled, traded blows, up

RACE.RACE_TEXT: LOUISIANA DOWNS RACE 5 7 1/2F Turf CR: 82. Claiming Purse 18750. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $25,000. (If deemed inadvisable by management to run this race over the turf course, it will be run on the main track at one mile and seventy yards).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: CHIEF ALPHA raced on the rail, was off of the pace and in the middle of the field, settled in hands, moved at he half mile marker, gained ground, was in traffic and gaining through the turn, split horses to challenged for the lead at the five sixteenth pole, was under encouragement and had the lead at the quarter pole, was kept on point driven down the stretch with rivals close behind but he kept them all at bay and took the win gamely. SUMMER LOVER was off of the pace in the two path, settled in hands and comfortably found his stride, moved at the half mile pole, improved position, circled on the outside in the turn, was ten wide in the upper stretch, was put to the task of closing and responded very well just missing for the win. CHROME RUN raced on the rail, was off of the pace and in the middle of a strung out field, moved a the half, improved position by the three eight s pole, angled out in the turn and was six wide in the upper stretch, found his best stride late and just missed for second. KING OF CONTRABAND was in the five path and stalking, launched his bid at the half mile pole, circled the field in the turn, challenged for thelead at he eighth pole, then tired in the last sixteenth. OGRE'S LION KING was off slow, improved late. PINCH HITTER vied for the lead, raced on the rail while setting the pace, tired. GHOST COWBOY was in the middle of the pack early and racing in the three path, settled in hands and given time to find his stride, advanced at the half mile pole and improved position, was in contention in the upper stretch but had no late kick. REVERENT stalked the leader from the three path, was asked to rate and was keen in his bridle, angled out into the four path nearing the three eighths pole and hen tired. BREAD WINNER stumbled after the break and was never involved. NOBLE HONOR falshed early speed and stopped.

ENTRY.NAME: Chrome Run
ENTRY.COMMENT: rail, mid pack, angled out 6 wide, 5-16th, best stride late

ENTRY.NAME: Ghost Cowboy
ENTRY.COMMENT: mid pack, 3w, settled in hands, advanced turn, no late kick

ENTRY.NAME: Chief Alpha
ENTRY.COMMENT: rail, mid pack, moved 1/2, split 5-16th, led 1/4, repelled, up

ENTRY.NAME: Pinch Hitter
ENTRY.OWNER: Haas Margaret Lanetta and Womack Larry D

ENTRY.NAME: King of Contraband
ENTRY.COMMENT: 5w, outside, stalked, bid 1/2, circled turn, chllngd 16th, tired

ENTRY.NAME: Summer Lover
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace, 2w, settled in hands, stride, mvd 1/2, angled 10w upper

ENTRY.NAME: Reverent
ENTRY.OWNER: Roe Steve D and Roe Patricia L

RACE.RACE_TEXT: LOUISIANA DOWNS RACE 6 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 79. Allowance Purse 31000. FOR ACCREDITED LA BRED THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since June 1 Allowed 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $20,000 Or Less Not Considered In Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: BIG BOO raced off of the pace and in the middle of the filed, advanced and improved position quickly and led by the five sixteenth poe, and was able to hold sway. REDDINGANDLEE was off a bit slow, gained ground and found his best stride late taking second. GUTZY vied for the lead and matched closely with another competitor while setting the fractions, then gave way. PITCH AND RUN was sharp out of the gates, stalked the leader and tired. LUCAS ZIP IT was no menace. HOOSIER was never involved. PAPIRINGO vied for the lead, attended t the pace, then tired. MR. CROMWELL trailed, MR. CROMWELL WAS PULLED UP AND VANNED OFF.

ENTRY.NAME: Big Boo
ENTRY.COMMENT: mid pack, advanced quickly, led 5-16th held sway

ENTRY.NAME: Reddingandlee
ENTRY.COMMENT: off slow, gained ground, best stride late

ENTRY.NAME: Papiringo
ENTRY.OWNER: Jarrett Jr Terrell and Lara Racing Stables LLC
ENTRY.COMMENT: flashed early speed, set the pace, tired

RACE.RACE_TEXT: LOUISIANA DOWNS RACE 7 7 1/2F Turf CR: 84. Claiming Purse 19000. FOR ACCREDITED LA BRED THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES OR WHICH HAVE NOT WON A RACE SINCE JULY 1, 2022. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since June 1, 2023 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $12,500. ( If deemed inadvisable by management to run this race over the turf course, it will be run on the main track at one mile and seventy yards).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: RIPITTOTHERIGHT went wire to wire. MR. FOUR SEVENS stalked the front runners, improved position, over came one of the early leaders, but could not get close to the winner but was second best today. SABER RUN was off in the middle of the field, found his best stride late and closed well. BAYOU SARGE was racing mid pack early and maintained that position through out. BODEE BODEE was off of te pace and allowed to settle in hands, was moved att he half, improved position and gained ground, was asked in the stretch and closed well. JUJU NINETEEN had no impact. CARLOS PUNCH flashed early speed, gave way. COUNTERFEIT was sharp outof the gates, settled into a stalking position, but had no kick. ITS A CITY DAY was never involved. NOW NOW MAN raced mid pack early then faltered. WISH UPON A STAR was no menace.

ENTRY.NAME: Bayou Sarge
ENTRY.COMMENT: mid pack, maintained positon through out

ENTRY.NAME: Its a City Day
ENTRY.OWNER: Jarrett Jr Terrell and Lara Racing Stables LLC
